thread.title: Astoria company recalls canned seafood over botulism
thread.title_full: Astoria company recalls canned seafood over botulism | OregonLive.com

author: Lynne Terry | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Astoria company recalls canned seafood over botulism
text:
An Astoria seafood company is recalling cans of fish over fears they're contaminated with botulism, which causes severe illness and can even be fatal.
Bornstein Seafoods, Inc. said in a recall notice posted on the Food and Drug Administration website that it is pulling canned salmon, sardines, sturgeon and tuna.
The products were distributed by Bornstein Seafoods nationwide and carry that company's label but they were made by Skipanon Brand Seafoods of Warrenton. The problem was discovered during a FDA inspection at the Warrenton facility. Skipanon announced a blanket recall a week ago .
The FDA said the cans were potentially under processed, which can cause botulism. The bacterium does not smell and can't be seen but it's potentially deadly. Symptoms of poisoning include weakness, dizziness, double-vision and trouble with speaking or swallowing. Difficulty in breathing, abdominal distension and constipation are also common.
The cans should be pitched. Anyone who experiences symptoms should seek immediate medical assistance.
No illnesses have been reported.
Consumers with questions about the Bornstein recalls should contact the company at 503-325-6164 or e-mail bornstein@bornstein.com . Skipanon can be reached at 503-861-8277 or by e-mail at recallskipanonbrand@gmail.com .
-- Lynne Terry
lterry@oregonian.com
@LynnePDX
